result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig W. Novy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Craig W. Novy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Craig W. Novy was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Craig W. Novy was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Craig W. Novy was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $500.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges (each count).
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Perform 100 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with Andrew Woods, Katherine Woods, Linda Fuhrer, Amy Janowitz, Amanda Thrams, Lisa Thrams, Frank Marano, or Laura Marano, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Deft is ordered to pay Jury Fees and Bailiff 1/2 day Fee for the morning.

Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Cts.1,3,4, and 6 -Dismissed  kmk
Jury costs are determined as $353.40 ($169.40 mileage & $184. per diem) plus $32.58 bailiff totals $385.98
Amended
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk
filed by Atty Henderson

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Craig W. Novy, appeared with Attorney Douglas I. Henderson.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Counts 2, 5 and 7 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1, 3, 4 and 6 are Dismissed by the State.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and statement given in court.  Sentencing arguments made.   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service.  Fined $500 plus costs on each count to be paid during probation.  DE is also ordered to pay fees for 23 jurors that were to be impaneled for trial today as well as fees for a 1/2 day Bailiff.  No contact with Andrew W., Katherine W., Linda F., Amy J., Amanda T., Frank M. or Laura M. unless permitted by the court.   Appeal Rights given.  (Jury fee and Bailiff fee to be calculated by the Clerk's Office)
Unsigned Verdicts
